New Records: Herro extended his streak of double-figure games to 61
Herro broke the Heat's previous record set by Tim Hardaway for scoring three-pointers
Adebayo reached a personal milestone with his 8,000th career point
Key Match Events: Kel'el Ware showcased his potential, particularly in the third quarter where his size and skills were pivotal in maintaining the Heat's lead
The Heat's lineup benefited from the return of key players Jimmy Butler and Duncan Robinson
The team faced sanctions earlier, with Terry Rozier suspended and Herro fined for an altercation in Houston
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Erik Spoelstra emphasized the importance of consistency and momentum
Spoelstra expressed his trust in Butler's readiness
The Heat looked to maintain their winning momentum, having previously succeeded at home against the Suns and Cavaliers
Post-Match Reflections: The Miami Heat's victory over the Pelicans not only highlighted Kel'el Ware's emerging talent but also underscored the team's resilience and focus on consistency
With key players returning and new milestones achieved, the Heat are poised to build on this momentum in upcoming games
Miscellaneous Highlights: The reunion of former teammates Corey Brewer, Butler, and Highsmith added a personal touch to the evening
The Heat managed their seventh back-to-back set this season
The game at Kaseya Center saw two promising rookies face off: Kel'el Ware of the Miami Heat and Yves Missi from the Pelicans
Others: The Pelicans began the game with Dejounte Murray, CJ McCollum, Herb Jones, Trey Murphy, and Missi, while Alec Burks and Nikola Jovic were the initial substitutes for the Heat, followed by Ware and Jaime Jaquez Jr.
